oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Forester Sisters Inerview - Biff Collie - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 2. Recording of an interview with Forester Sisters (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Forester Sisters; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The Forester Sisters talk about their fourteen top ten records -- (00:36) Biff Collie asks about their latest album and June Forester responds -- (00:53) "(That's What You Do) When You're in Love" is discussed by Collie and June about how the Forester Sisters had to re-cut -- (01:21) June and Collie discuss having to vote amongst team members for music selection -- (02:29) Kathy Forester readdresses "(That's What You Do) When You're in Love" -- (02:49) Collie and Kim recall "I Fell in Love Again Last Night" as a career record for the Forester Sisters -- (03:16) The Forester Sisters joke about who gets to sing lead -- (03:56) Collie and the Forester Sisters talk about the switching roles of the sisters for different songs -- (04:37) The Forester Sisters talk about switching, different styles, and losing Kathy for a month -- (05:21) June introduces "I Fell in Love Again Last Night" -- (05:31) Collie and the Forester Sisters talk about "I'd Choose You Again" -- (06:00) Kathy talks about lead singers and harmonizing -- (06:45) Collie asks the Forester Sisters to list their number one singles in order -- (07:26) Collie and the Forester Sisters talk about their dreams of record deals as children and the harsh reality of music -- (08:27) "Letter Home" is discussed by the Forester Sisters as a song about a young girl who left home expecting the world -- (09:35) "Leave It Alone" is discussed by the Forester Sisters and Collie as the Forester Sisters getting in a "ballad rut" -- (10:30) Kim talks about their ballads and the combination between upbeat and downbeat songs in their shows -- (11:22) Collie asks the Forester Sisters about their instruments and the Forester Sisters tells about their liquid nature of using instruments -- (12:27) Collie and Kim talk about why she has stuck to guitar -- "Too Much is Not Enough" performed with the Bellamy Brothers is discussed through their relationship with the Bellamy Brothers -- (14:28) The Forester Sisters discuss "Just In Case" almost not being released and the Forester Sisters first producers -- (16:16) Kathy talks about a venue burning down without any communication from the venue -- (16:49) Kathy discusses "Lonely Alone" as a lost song that gave a different direction from the first album -- (17:32) Kathy talks about how old everyone was when they started singing and June talks about radio influences -- (18:58) Collie asks about a recording of "Sincerity" and Kathy talks about meeting the McGuire Sisters at one of the Forester Sisters shows -- (19:41) Kathy talks about the McGuire Sisters more identical styling versus the Forester Sisters less repeating style -- (20:22) June talks about wanting to do another project -- (21:02) Collie thanks the Forester Sisters for being there and the Forester Sister say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Forester Sisters; Collie, Biff;
